meanings.definition: The unit of time equal to 1/60th of a minute.
meanings.sent1: A seconde is a very short amount of time.
meanings.sent2: She glanced at the clock and saw only a seconde had passed.
meanings.sent3: Waiting for the kettle to boil felt like an eternity, but in reality, it was just a seconde.
meanings.sent4: In the blink of a seconde, everything changed.
meanings.sent5: The seconde hand on the clock moved swiftly, marking each passing moment.

meanings.definition: To support or assist someone in a duel.
meanings.sent1: He agreed to seconde his friend in the upcoming duel.
meanings.sent2: The loyal squire was always ready to seconde his knight in battle.
meanings.sent3: The idea of having a pet parrot to seconde you in a duel is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her unwavering determination secondeed her through the toughest challenges.
meanings.sent5: The trusty shield secondeed him as he faced his opponent in the duel.

meanings.definition: The second in order or rank.
meanings.sent1: She was the seconde in command after the captain.
meanings.sent2: The seconde place winner proudly held up the silver medal.
meanings.sent3: Being the seconde violinist in the orchestra was both challenging and rewarding.
meanings.sent4: The seconde star to the right guided them on their journey.
meanings.sent5: The seconde chapter of the book revealed a surprising twist in the plot.

meanings.definition: To transfer to a different position or role.
meanings.sent1: He was secondeed to the marketing department for a special project.
meanings.sent2: The experienced teacher was secondeed to train the new staff.
meanings.sent3: The idea to seconde the office plant as the new CEO was met with laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for art led her to be secondeed to the art gallery.
meanings.sent5: The decision to seconde him to the leadership role was met with mixed reactions.
